text: We should be most concerned by companies that make OON a strategy to drive up revenue. This is a deceptive practice that isn’t sustainable
Most physicians who are out-of-networks aren’t trying to screw patients. They’re OON because of challenges negotiating with many insurers.
Firms that choose OON billing as a strategy have OON rates that are way way WAY higher than in-network payments.
There are a small number of cases where OON rates would be higher than in-network rates. These would be exceptions not the rule.
Some companies bill out-of-network billing as a deliberate strategy. Don’t believe me
